reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a very pleasant, modern room - with a comfortable bed - overlooking the lake. The staff on the front desk were a credit to the place, helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great potential

reviews.text: The hotel was slightly let down by the quality of its catering, nothing disastrous but a bit odd. For example my gravadlax starter came with just one (tiny) piece of bread, my salad Niçoise had no lettuce (though the helpful waiter brought me some when I asked if it was possible). As a business traveller my biggest gripe is that it's hard to eat healthily when I'm away and - in spite of the spa and the gym - the restaurant wasn't really doing its bit.
reviews.title: Didn't enjoy it at all

reviews.title: beautiful setting... not suitable for arachnaphobes!

likes.disliked: — i dont mind a bit of nature, but this place was a bit of a popular getaway for spiders too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay (3 nights) and would recommend this hotel , with several minor reservations, and we would return ourselves. As all double rooms were booked, we booked a suite. This had an entrance hall, good size bathroom and bedroom and a large sitting room. It had a balcony overlooking the lake. The only thing missing was any type of fridge.
reviews.title: New hotel near Cotswolds

reviews.text: We booked a two night stay at the Four Pillars Cotswold Water Park and found the hotel exceeded our expectations as a young family wanting a short break. Some reviews we had read found service lacking at mealtimes, we didn't find this to be true. We only had a bed and breakfast package but did sample the lounge menu and found the food and service very good at all times. The staff we encountered were polite, helpful and always asking if there was anything we needed. They welcomed our two and a half year old and recommended child friendly places to eat in the surrounding area too. All in all we found the hotel was very clean, modern decor, nicely located with helpful staff and a great pool. Wouldn't particularly suggest Cirencester a good place to eat in the evenings as there isn't much there. Would though recommend the Wild Duck Inn at Ewen for an atmospheric pub meal. About four to five miles from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a work conference and overall thought it very good.
reviews.title: Nice weekend

reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the traffic noise

description: This contemporary 4 star hotel is superbly located in the heart of the Cotswold Water Park, only three miles from Cirencester and six miles from Swindon. The hotel offers guests a wealth of amenities and outdoor activities.This exclusive resort enjoys an unsurpassed setting of lakes, rivers, wetlands and grassland. Stunning views, open spaces and a wealth of leisure and active pursuits make this the perfect place for a visit or for a break all year round.
